intro: Crotalaria sessiliflora subsp. hazarensis, commonly known as the Hazara crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of South Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically has palmately lobed leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic characteristics compared to other Crotalaria species.
